page.title: 14Village Life remembered
page.content: Mrs. Holkan was a village school teacher.Before 1919 she taught children from 5-14years in Luddington. She received Â£1 a month.There were about 20 children in her class.Mrs. Holkan took about 50 children 4-7 years. She took them until she left school. If you were a lady you couldn't teach if you married. The children walked about 1mile to school. Mrs. Holkan used to make her own butter which the farm helpers churned for her. They kept a yard full of pigs, 4-5 cows and about 100 bullocks.They grew potatoes,barley and sugar beet.They grow cereals now.Farming has changed completely.Mrs Holkan has a spade that dug the first bit of earth of the Eastoft railway in 1898.Mrs Holkan had the first car in Eastoft.
